Quotation: Josephine - The earliest tenth-named storm in Atlantic history came onto the scene August 13 with the NOAA-National Hurricane Center’s upgrade of Tropical Depression 11 to Tropical Storm Josephine.
Five of the nine named storms so far have struck the United States, making this the earliest in any season that so many U.S. landfalls have occurred. (The old record was August 18, 1916.)
The contiguous U.S. average minimum (nighttime) temperature during July was 62.9°F, 2.4°F above the 20th century average, ranking fourth warmest on record.
